Trial_Design.evidence: A multicenter, cooperative group, single-arm phase II trial

Participants.evidence: Patients with biopsy-confirmed PDAC in the pancreatic head without evidence of involvement of major mesenteric vessels (resectable) were eligible.

Intervention.evidence: Patients (n=123) received an eight-week cycle of G+E before and after surgery.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluated perioperative gemcitabine + erlotinib (G+E) for resectable PDAC.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was two-year overall survival (OS)

Number_Randomised.evidence: Patients (n=123) received an eight-week cycle of G+E before and after surgery.

Number_Analysed.evidence: One hundred fourteen patients were eligible, consented, and initiated protocol treatment.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The two-year OS rate for the entire cohort (n=114) was 40% (95%CI 31–50) with a median OS of 21.3 months (95%CI 17.2–25.9).

Harms.evidence: Grade 3+ toxicity was reported in 60% and 79% of patients during the neoadjuvant phase and overall, respectively.
